discussion.author: noahbenson
discussion.text:
Hello. I would like to register this package. It seems that the only issue is that the name is short (Air.jl) and additionally is similar to other packages with short names. I am okay with this and would like to register it anyway.
Some context: Air stands for **A**tomic **I**mmutables **R**esource—it's a toolbox for using persistent (immutable) data structures and [STM](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Software_transactional_memory) in Julia. The data structures are functionally similar to those in the old `FunctionalCollections` repository (which I believe is no longer maintained), but they have been rewritten from the ground-up. The STM resources in Air let you compose arbitrary thread-safe atomic operations on immutable data.
Air is also a nice poetic name that captures something about the feel of the library that isn't particularly quantifiable—similar to libraries like [Avalon](https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/tree/master/A/Avalon) and [Fire](https://github.com/JuliaRegistries/General/tree/master/F/Fire).
Thanks!

discussion.author: noahbenson
JuliaRegistrator
discussion.text: An unexpected error occurred during registration.
